title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Rashid Jafari T (2025). auflights: Australian Aviation Data Teaching. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/Tinarj/auflights.
code: @Manual{,   title = {auflights: Australian Aviation Data for Teaching},   author = {Tina {Rashid Jafari}},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/Tinarj/auflights}, }

what: Monthly top domestic routes in Australia — au_dom_routes
title: Monthly top domestic routes in Australia — au_dom_routes
text: Monthly traffic busiest domestic airline routes Australia, including passengers, flights seats origin–destination pair. Data cover revenue (paying) passengers regular public transport (RPT) services 2016 onward.

title: Monthly top domestic routes in Australia — au_dom_routes
Monthly top domestic routes in Australia — au_dom_routes
text: Data frame columns: origin_airport Three-letter IATA code origin airport (e.g. "SYD" Sydney). dest_airport Three-letter IATA code destination airport (e.g. "MEL" Melbourne). origin_city Name origin city (e.g. "Sydney"). dest_city Name destination city (e.g. "Melbourne"). year Calendar year, e.g. 2016. month Calendar month 1–12 (1 = January, 12 = December). n_passengers Number revenue (paying) passengers carried route month, directions combined. n_flights Number aircraft trips (flights) operated route month. n_seats Total number seats offered flights route month (capacity).

title: Monthly top domestic routes in Australia — au_dom_routes
text: Bureau Infrastructure Transport Research Economics (BITRE), Domestic aviation statistics – Top routes. Data downloaded https://www.bitre.gov.au/publications/ongoing/domestic_airline_activity-time_series.

title: Monthly top domestic routes in Australia — au_dom_routes
code: au_dom_routes #> # A tibble: 8,595 × 9 #>    origin_airport dest_airport origin_city dest_city  year month n_passengers #>    <chr>          <chr>        <chr>       <chr>     <dbl> <dbl>        <dbl> #>  1 ABX            SYD          Albury      Sydney     2016     1        16007 #>  2 ABX            SYD          Albury      Sydney     2016     2        16461 #>  3 ABX            SYD          Albury      Sydney     2016     3        19486 #>  4 ABX            SYD          Albury      Sydney     2016     4        19155 #>  5 ABX            SYD          Albury      Sydney     2016     5        19278 #>  6 ABX            SYD          Albury      Sydney     2016     6        17766 #>  7 ABX            SYD          Albury      Sydney     2016     7        19599 #>  8 ABX            SYD          Albury      Sydney     2016     8        20126 #>  9 ABX            SYD          Albury      Sydney     2016     9        20218 #> 10 ABX            SYD          Albury      Sydney     2016    10        19717 #> # ℹ 8,585 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: n_flights <dbl>, n_seats <dbl>

what: International airline traffic by carrier to and from Australia — au_int_airlines
title: International airline traffic by carrier to and from Australia — au_int_airlines
text: Monthly flights, passenger seat counts international airlines operating services Australia, grouped airline country service, 2016 onward.

title: International airline traffic by carrier to and from Australia — au_int_airlines
International airline traffic by carrier to and from Australia — au_int_airlines
text: Data frame columns: airline Airline name. country Country service n_flights_in Number flights inbound Australia month. n_passengers_in Passengers carried inbound Australia flights. airlines includes passengers transiting via Australia. n_seats_in Available seats inbound Australia. n_flights_out Number flights outbound Australia month. n_passengers_out Passengers carried outbound Australia. year Calendar year. month Calendar month (1–12).

title: International airline traffic by carrier to and from Australia — au_int_airlines
text: Bureau Infrastructure Transport Research Economics (BITRE). Downloaded https://www.bitre.gov.au/publications/ongoing/international_airline_activity-time_series.

title: International airline traffic by carrier to and from Australia — au_int_airlines
code: # Top 10 carriers by total inbound passengers since 2016 au_int_airlines |>   dplyr::group_by(airline) |>   dplyr::summarise(total_in = sum(n_passengers_in, na.rm = TRUE)) |>   dplyr::arrange(dplyr::desc(total_in)) |>   dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) #> # A tibble: 10 × 2 #>    airline                total_in #>    <chr>                     <dbl> #>  1 Qantas Airways         27376794 #>  2 Jetstar                15181678 #>  3 Singapore Airlines     13468058 #>  4 Emirates               11589878 #>  5 Air New Zealand        10589764 #>  6 Virgin Australia        7299346 #>  7 Cathay Pacific Airways  5980570 #>  8 Qatar Airways           4769969 #>  9 AirAsia X               4113463 #> 10 Malaysia Airlines       3881610

what: International airline flights and seats by airline, route and city pair — au_int_citypairs
title: International airline flights and seats by airline, route and city pair — au_int_citypairs
text: Monthly scheduled international passenger flights seats operated Australia, broken airline, route Australian–foreign city pair. package data restricted calendar years 2016 onwards.

title: International airline flights and seats by airline, route and city pair — au_int_citypairs
International airline flights and seats by airline, route and city pair — au_int_citypairs
text: Data frame columns: australian Name Australian city. international Name overseas city. airline Operating airline. route Full route string flight number. port_country Country international port. port_region Geographic region international port. service_country “Country service” – international country –flight–number service originates terminates. service_region Region corresponding service_country. stops Number intermediate stops route city pair. 0 indicates “coast” (directly connected) services. all_flights Number flights operated route available city pair “flights” definition. max_seats Maximum number seats associated all_flights city pair. in_out Direction service relative Australia: "" = inbound Australia, "O" = outbound Australia. year Calendar year. month Calendar month integer 1 (January) 12 (December).

title: International airline flights and seats by airline, route and city pair — au_int_citypairs
text: Bureau Infrastructure Transport Research Economics (BITRE), downloaded : https://www.bitre.gov.au/publications/ongoing/international_airline_activity-time_series.

title: International airline flights and seats by airline, route and city pair — au_int_citypairs
code: au_int_citypairs |> dplyr::filter(in_out == "I", stops == 0) |> dplyr::group_by(airline) |> dplyr::summarise(total_seats = sum(max_seats, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop") |> dplyr::arrange(desc(total_seats)) |> dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) #> # A tibble: 10 × 2 #>    airline                total_seats #>    <chr>                        <dbl> #>  1 Qantas Airways            32626584 #>  2 Jetstar                   17526766 #>  3 Singapore Airlines        16473008 #>  4 Emirates                  15290777 #>  5 Air New Zealand           13123155 #>  6 Virgin Australia           9554486 #>  7 Cathay Pacific Airways     7492084 #>  8 Qatar Airways              6431509 #>  9 AirAsia X                  5352646 #> 10 Malaysia Airlines          4842279

what: International airline city-pair passengers to and from Australia — au_int_routes
title: International airline city-pair passengers to and from Australia — au_int_routes
text: Monthly inbound outbound passenger counts international city-pair routes Australian airports overseas cities, 2016 onward.

title: International airline city-pair passengers to and from Australia — au_int_routes
International airline city-pair passengers to and from Australia — au_int_routes
text: Data frame columns: origin_city Name Australian city/airport. dest_city Name overseas city/airport. dest_country Destination country overseas airport. n_passengers_in Number revenue passengers arriving Australia route given month. n_passengers_out Number revenue passengers departing Australia route given month. year Calendar year. month Calendar month.

title: International airline city-pair passengers to and from Australia — au_int_routes
text: Bureau Infrastructure Transport Research Economics (BITRE). Downloaded https://www.bitre.gov.au/publications/ongoing/international_airline_activity-time_series.

title: International airline city-pair passengers to and from Australia — au_int_routes
code: # Top 10 total inbound passengers by country au_int_routes |> dplyr::group_by(dest_country) |> dplyr::summarise(total_in = sum(n_passengers_in, na.rm = TRUE)) |> dplyr::arrange(desc(total_in)) |> dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) #> # A tibble: 10 × 2 #>    dest_country         total_in #>    <chr>                   <dbl> #>  1 New Zealand          26657876 #>  2 Singapore            23188329 #>  3 Indonesia            13330385 #>  4 United Arab Emirates 13124085 #>  5 USA                  11097421 #>  6 China                10659929 #>  7 Hong Kong (SAR)       8643434 #>  8 Malaysia              8604349 #>  9 Thailand              5803042 #> 10 Japan                 5652710
